net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database

Class SQLitePortal

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
      • net.zer0bandwidth.android.lib.database.SQLitePortal
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SQLiteAssetPortal, SQLiteHouse

    public abstract class SQLitePortal
extends android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
    Extends SQLiteOpenHelper with a few additional features.

    Database Connection Management

    The portal maintains its own persistent reference to the underlying SQLite database. This connection is established with a background thread kicked off by the openDB() method. The class provides variants of this method allowing the caller to specify whether the connection should be opened read-only, and provide a ConnectionListener instance which can handle the onDatabaseConnected() callback method.

    The portal's close() method also overrides the parent's, so that it can close the connection to the database before closing out the portal itself.

    Static Constants and Utility Methods

    The class provides several static methods that are generally useful when dealing with SQLite databases. In particular:

    closeCursor(Cursor)
    Safely closes a cursor, checking first whether the object is null or has already been closed previously.
    boolToInt(boolean) and intToBool(int)
    Converts between Boolean values and the integer values typically used to represent them in SQLite.

    Since 0.1.1 (#20), some of these items also form the basis of QueryBuilder and its descendants.

    Note that most of the static constants provided by this class were moved to SQLiteSyntax in 0.1.7 (#48).

    Since:
    zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.0.2 (#8)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  SQLitePortal.ConnectionListener
      Classes interested in immediately reacting to a database's connection status may implement this interface to catch the event.
      protected class  SQLitePortal.ConnectionTask
      Allows the SQLitePortal to create a persistent connection to its underlying database on a background thread.

      • m_nLatestVersion

        protected int m_nLatestVersion
        Remembers the version number with which the instance was constructed. This is kept private in SQLiteOpenHelper, so in order to use this in SQLitePortal and its descendants, we have to copy it here.
        Since:
        zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.4 (#26)

    • Method Detail

      • closeCursor

        public static void closeCursor(android.database.Cursor crs)
        Safely closes a database cursor. If the reference is null, or the cursor is already closed, then the method returns trivially.
        Parameters:
        crs - the cursor to be closed

        Returns:
        1 for true or 0 for false

        Parameters:
        z - the integer to be converted
        Returns:
        true iff the integer is non-zero

      • closeDB

        public SQLitePortal closeDB()
        Closes the database connection and releases all references to it.

        Note: Since 0.1.4 (#34), there is no need to invoke this method before close(); this class now overrides the parent's close() method to call closeDB() first.

        Returns:
        (fluid)

      • close

        Closes the database connection and releases all references to it, before closing the portal itself.
        Overrides:
        close in class android.database.sqlite.SQLiteOpenHelper
        Since:
        zer0bandwidth-net/android 0.1.4 (#34)
